etymologies: late 15th century: from French tambour ‘drum’; perhaps related to Persian tabīra ‘drum’. Compare with tabor

definitions: a circular frame for holding fabric taut while it is being embroidered.
shortDefinitions: circular frame for holding fabric taut while it is being embroidered

definitions: a wall of circular plan, such as one supporting a dome or surrounded by a colonnade.
each of a sequence of cylindrical stones forming the shaft of a column.
shortDefinitions: each of sequence of cylindrical stones forming shaft of column

definitions: a sliding flexible shutter or door on a piece of furniture, made of strips of wood attached to a backing of canvas
shortDefinitions: sliding flexible shutter or door on piece of furniture

definitions: a projecting part of the wall of a tennis court.
shortDefinitions: sloping buttress or projection in real tennis or fives court
